result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ELIJAH R RYBA

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:52 PM Defendant ELIJAH R RYBA not in court.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for ELIJAH R RYBA.  Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant medically excused. Time limits waived per Court. Attorney Harless does not object.
Review hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:43 PM Defendant ELIJAH R RYBA in court.  Attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case and notes appearances.
Defendant is reapplying for public defender.
New hearing date set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
Defendant shall not go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / syringes unless medically required.
Defendant shall not possess or consume illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed.

ADA Matthews informs the Court the defendant has been noncompliant with pretrial monitoring. Requests cash bond. 
Attorney Schroeder informs the Court the defendant was previously hospitalized and received a medical diagnosis. Requests signature bond. 
Court modifies bond to $200 cash bond.

10:07 AM Defendant ELIJAH R RYBA appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder appeared by video for ELIJAH R RYBA.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant quashed. 
Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Defendant to apply for county appointment. 
Clerk to send packet to defendant.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ELIJAH R RYBA not in court. 
Body only- extradite.

2:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ELIJAH R RYBA not in court. 
ADA Zehr informs the Court the defendant is currently in the emergency room. 
Defendant has been noncompliant with pretrial monitoring. 
Clerk to send notice of hearing. 
Bond continued.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
Defendant shall not go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / syringes unless medically required.
Defendant shall not possess or consume illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ELIJAH R RYBA appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder appeared by video for ELIJAH R RYBA.
